p.s: Effective or Problematic? vol. 26 - the German perspective on the outcome of COP26
The Glasgow conference which was aiming to solve the global challenges that we are facing right now was not held long ago.
But it was enough to have an opinion about it.

So has Ant√≥nio Guterrez, known as the Secretary-General of the United Nations, because even though she wants to spread hope regarding the climate crisis, he is quite skeptical about the outcome of the conference.
Jochen Flasbarth, State secretary Ministry for the Environment and Nature Protection in Germany does not agree with Guterrez.
In his opinion the conference room a step forward.
According to Flasbarth, many people overestimate the conference because there are not able to solve everything immediately.
It is quite time consuming.
But how much time do we have left?
This question cannot only scientist answer but especially smaller countries that are suffering from the global warming.
Because they cannot afford to talk any longer about the issue but need help for the action.
In order to change something the countries have to make concrete plans, that are realistic.
It did not work out very well as we can see the result of stopping the promotion of coal which has been weakened.
Because India and China do not want to stop their coal production.
The actual aim is to phase down the production.
Flasbarth still sees it optimistic because it was not even planned to discuss the abandonment of coal, so for him is it one step in the right direction.
He sees Glasgow as a success.
But not everybody agrees, many people see it as a show because the countries blame each other and do not want to take responsibility.
We can see that with France, who arm themselves with more nuclear power.
Germany has also ambitious goals for the future such as only using renewable energy for electricity.
If there are able to realize this plan, we will see.
